укорениться: to take root, to become ingrained
умничать: to show off one's intelligence, to smart-aleck
упершийся: stubborn (lit. having dug in one's heels)
Урд: Urd (Norse mythology: one of the Norns)
ученный: learned, scholarly (adj., archaic/colloquial variant of учёный)
у разбитого корыта: back to square one, with nothing (lit. at a broken trough)
у страха глаза велики: fear has big eyes (idiom: fear exaggerates danger)
убивший двух зайцев: killed two birds with one stone (lit. killed two hares)
удар ниже пояса: low blow (lit. hit below the belt)
ударивший лицом в грязь: who fell flat on his face (lit. hit face in mud)
ум за разум заходит: mind is going astray, losing one's mind (present tense)
ум за разум зашел: mind went astray, lost one's mind (past tense)
умные люди мыслят одинаково: great minds think alike (lit. smart people think identically)
упасть не встать: to fall completely, to fall disastrously (idiom)
упрямый как баран: stubborn as a mule (lit. stubborn as a ram)
устойчивый мужской порыв: a strong male impulse (euphemism for erection)
утро вечера мудренее: morning is wiser than evening (idiom: sleep on it)
уходит корнями: goes back to the roots, is rooted in
ухом не ведет: doesn't bat an eye (lit. doesn't move an ear)
уши вянут: ears are wilting (idiom: disgusted by what one hears)
убраться: to clean up, to get out (colloquial)
уважаемый: respected, esteemed (also used as 'Dear' in formal address)
угодно: as you wish, any (e.g., 'что угодно' - anything)
укрупненно: in consolidated form, on a larger scale
уметь: to be able to, to know how to
умница: clever person (male or female, often praise)
упершись: leaning against, having dug in one's heels
усердствовать: to be zealous, to overdo it (often with negative connotation)
устроить: to arrange, to organize, to suit
утакута: utakuta (uncommon, possibly typo or very rare/specific term)
утверждать: to affirm, to assert, to approve
учитывать: to take into account, to consider
у черта на куличках: in the middle of nowhere (lit. at the devil's kulichki)
убить двух зайцев: to kill two birds with one stone
убиться веником: to kill oneself with a broom (idiom, meaning to exhaust oneself pointlessly)
угол зрения: point of view, angle of vision
ума не приложу: I have no idea (lit. I won't apply my mind)
ума палата: very smart (lit. a chamber of mind)
умереть и не встать: to die and not get up (idiom for extreme amazement/shock)
утереть нос: to put someone's nose out of joint, to outdo (lit. to wipe someone's nose)
утки зябли: ducks were cold (children's rhyme element, not a common phrase)
утративший силу: null and void (lit. having lost force)
уходит корнями: goes back to the roots, is rooted in
уши вянут: ears are wilting (idiom: disgusted by what one hears)
